item.title: Comparative between OpenVPN and Wireguard
item.description:
The goal of this post is to compare the different VPNs software most used by seeing which is faster, for which we will support in speed test using iperf3.

[NOTE] The comparative part of the posts in this section in which we mount each type of VPN.

Speed without VPN

I’m gonna start by comparing the speeds of these 2 systems, using iperf3. For this I have removed the cisco router as I had it configured with FastEthernet interfaces and changed it to a Linux router with GigabitEthernet interfaces.

item.title: VPN site to site Wireguard
item.description:
[!NOTE] I will start from the VPN post remote access with Wireguard, so you may refer to this one during this article.

Key generation

The first thing we will do is to install both the Wireguard package in both machines:

root@servidor1:~# sudo apt update && sudo apt install wireguard
debian@servidor2:~$ sudo apt update && sudo apt install wireguard

Let’s generate the pairs of keys that will be used to encrypt the connection. We will need a key for the server and a couple of additional keys for each client.
